contextId.information: This can be expressed as a statement. "Surely there is no one whom the king would take pleasure in honoring more than me!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Whom would the king take pleasure in honoring more than me?

contextId.information: The king uses this question to show his shock and anger at what Haman was doing. This question can be translated as a statement. AT: "He even dares to attack the queen in my presence and in my own house!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Will he assault the queen in my presence in my own house?

contextId.information: Esther used these questions to show that that she would be extremely sad if her people were to be destroyed. AT: "I cannot bear to see disaster fall on the Jews. I cannot endure watching my relatives be killed." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: For how could I bear to see disaster fall on my people? How could I endure watching the destruction of my relatives?
